meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>accumulate</kanji> and the verb version is <vocabulary>to accumulate</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: If something accumulates, you can start with one, but you need at least <reading>two</reading> (つ) things to say it has accumulated. If you don't, then there's nothing accumulating at all.
